channel.title: TGaceAllStories
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from TGaceAllStories, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: American Airlines temporarily grounded U.S. flights because of technical glitch
item.description: American Airlines briefly grounds flights nationwide citing a technical glitch.

item.title: Dow climbs more than 200 points in shortened trading on Christmas Eve: Live updates
item.description: The major averages posted modest gains on Monday to begin the holiday-shortened trading week.

item.title: Nissan could face cost-cutting 'carnage' in Honda merger, Carlos Ghosn says
item.description: "There is practically no complementarity here," the former Nissan CEO told CNBC.

item.title: Here's why business leaders are spending big on Trump's inaugural committee
item.description: Donations to President-elect Donald Trump's inaugural committee offer a "unique opportunity" to curry favor with the White House, experts told CNBC.

item.title: Lumps of coal for Wall Street money managers — again
item.description: Once again, you were better off buying the assets on Wall Street that were the most hated by the big-money crowd than the assets that were most loved.

item.title: Former President Bill Clinton released from hospital after being treated for the flu
item.description: Clinton was admitted to a Georgetown hospital with a fever on Monday.

item.title: My friend has a dependent son, 32, who drives without car insurance. Would his parents be criminally liable if he has an accident?
item.description: “They declare him as a dependent for tax purposes.”

item.title: Digital health companies got pummeled by Wall Street in 2024 as industry adapts to post-Covid slowdown
item.description: It's been nearly five years since the coronavirus broke out in the U.S., but digital health companies are still reeling.

item.title: FDA says the Zepbound shortage is over. Here’s what that means for compounding pharmacies, patients who used off-brand versions
item.description: The decision will largely prevent compounding pharmacies from making and selling compounded versions of the drug in the next two to three months.

item.title: ‘I worked hard for my savings’: I’m 71 and a retired teacher. I want to give my kids money — but my daughter spends lavishly and my son is wealthy.
item.description: “I have been reading about the idea of giving your children money when they need it the most, rather than waiting until you die.”
